search_results.snippet:
A blackout during war, or in preparation for an expected war, is the practice of 
collectively minimizing outdoor light, including upwardly directed (or reflected) 
light. This was done in the 20th century to prevent crews of enemy aircraft from 
being able to identify their targets by sight, for example during the London Blitz of 
1940. ... Blackout regulations were imposed on 1 September 1939, before the...
